translated: If one is thirsty from the heat of a strong fire in one who has eaten oily food, one should give water that is not naturally cold.

original: snum ma zhu la chu tshan blud ;
analyzed: snum ma zhu la chu tshan blud ;
translated: If one is thirsty from indigestion of oil, one should give hot water.

original: / zhu las skom la thug pa blud //🔽ces bya ba la /🔽snum ma zhu ba la skom dad du gyur pa la ni chu tshan blud par bya'o //
analyzed: / zhu las skom la thug pa blud // ces bya ba la / snum ma zhu ba la skom dad du gyur pa la ni chu tshan blud par bya'o //
translated: If one is thirsty from digestion, one should give thin gruel.🔽If one is thirsty from indigestion of oil, one should give hot water.

original: snum zhu ba las gyur pa'i skom dad la ni thug pa rkyang rkyang po blud par bya'o //
analyzed: snum zhu ba las gyur pa'i skom dad la ni thug pa rkyang rkyang po blud par bya'o //
translated: If one is thirsty from digestion of oil, one should give thin gruel.

original: zas snum zos pas skom dad gyur //
analyzed: zas snum zos pas skom dad gyur //
translated: If one is thirsty from eating oily food,

original: kha ra dang mnyam bu ram chu //🔽zhes bya ba la /🔽kha zas snum po kri sa ra dang 'o thug la sogs pa zos pa las skom dad du gyur pa la ni /
analyzed: kha ra dang mnyam bu ram chu // zhes bya ba la / kha zas snum po kri sa ra dang 'o thug la sogs pa zos pa las skom dad du gyur pa la ni /
translated: one should give sugar-cane juice.

original: kha ra dang mnyam par bsgrangs pa'i bu ram gyi chu blud par bya'o //
analyzed: kha ra dang mnyam par bsgrangs pa'i bu ram gyi chu blud par bya'o //
translated: If one is thirsty from eating oily food such as krisara and milk-rice, one should give sugar-cane juice mixed with sugar.

original: bu ram sogs zas zos las skom //
analyzed: bu ram sogs zas zos las skom //
translated: If one is thirsty from eating sugar-cane and so forth,

original: chu dron blud la de slon bya //
analyzed: chu dron blud la de slon bya //
translated: one should give warm water and then induce vomiting.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /

original: bu ram la sogs pa'i zas zos pa las skom dad du gyur pa la ni chu dron blud la zas de slon du gzhug go //
analyzed: bu ram la sogs pa'i zas zos pa las skom dad du gyur pa la ni chu dron blud la zas de slon du gzhug go //
translated: If one has eaten food such as molasses, etc., and has a thirst from it, one should give him warm water and make him eat that food.

original: gcong chen las byung gcong la phan //
analyzed: gcong chen las byung gcong la phan //
translated: If one has a thirst from a great internal fever, one should give him food and drink that are good for the great fever.🔽If one has a thirst from a wasting disease, one should give him food and drink that are good for the wasting disease.

original: thams cad nyams ni brta ba phan //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thams cad nyams ni brta ba phan // zhes bya ba la /
translated: If one has a thirst from a loss of strength, one should give him food and drink that are good for the loss of strength.🔽If one has a thirst from a loss of flesh, one should give him food and drink that are good for the loss of flesh.🔽If one has a thirst from a loss of blood, one should give him food and drink that are good for the loss of blood.🔽If one has a thirst from a loss of strength, one should give him food and drink that are good for the loss of strength.🔽If one has a thirst from a loss of flesh, one should give him food and drink that are good for the loss of flesh.🔽If one has a thirst from a loss of blood, one should give him food and drink that are good for the loss of blood.🔽If one has a thirst from a loss of strength, one should give him food and drink that are good for the loss of strength.

original: zad byed kyi nad gcong chen po las byung ba'i bla brnan gyi skom dad la ni bza' ba dang btung ba dang @265b spyod lam dang sman la sogs pa thams cad dang gcong chen po la phan pa dag byas na phan pa dang / de bzhin du nyams brta pa'i sman dag byas na phan no //
analyzed: zad byed kyi nad gcong chen po las byung ba'i bla brnan gyi skom dad la ni bza' ba dang btung ba dang @265b spyod lam dang sman la sogs pa thams cad dang gcong chen po la phan pa dag byas na phan pa dang / de bzhin du nyams brta pa'i sman dag byas na phan no //
translated: If one has a thirst from a loss of flesh, one should give him food and drink that are good for the loss of flesh.🔽If one has a thirst from a loss of blood, one should give him food and drink that are good for the loss of blood.

original: skem zhing nyam chung khong rtsub la //🔽sha khu 'am ra yi 'o ma blud //
analyzed: skem zhing nyam chung khong rtsub la // sha khu 'am ra yi 'o ma blud //
translated: If one has a thirst from a loss of strength, one should give him food and drink that are good for the loss of strength.🔽If one has a thirst from a loss of flesh, one should give him food and drink that are good for the loss of flesh.

original: stod rgyu'i rung la 'o ma dang // zad byed lud pa'i sman bskol blud //🔽ces bya ba la /
analyzed: stod rgyu'i rung la 'o ma dang // zad byed lud pa'i sman bskol blud // ces bya ba la /
translated: If one has a thirst from a loss of blood, one should give him food and drink that are good for the loss of blood.

original: stod du rgyu ba'i rlung dang bcas pa las gyur pa'i skom dad la ni /
analyzed: stod du rgyu ba'i rlung dang bcas pa las gyur pa'i skom dad la ni /
translated: If one has a thirst from a loss of strength, one should give him food and drink that are good for the loss of strength.

original: ra'i 'o ma dang zad byed dang / lud pa'i sman gang dag yin pa dang bskol ba blud na phan no //
analyzed: ra'i 'o ma dang zad byed dang / lud pa'i sman gang dag yin pa dang bskol ba blud na phan no //
translated: Milk of the goat, and the medicine for phlegm, and the decoction which is beneficial.

original: nad rkyen las gyur 'u su yi //🔽'bras bskol kha ra sbrang rtsir bcas ;
analyzed: nad rkyen las gyur 'u su yi // 'bras bskol kha ra sbrang rtsir bcas ;
translated: In the thirst which arises from the condition of the disease,

original: / nad dmigs la ni ltos nas ni //🔽btung ba'i bya ba kun kyang bsngags //
analyzed: / nad dmigs la ni ltos nas ni // btung ba'i bya ba kun kyang bsngags //
translated: the decoction of the fruit of the emblic myrobalan, with sugar and honey,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: is recommended, and all the actions of the treatment of drinking,🔽in consideration of the basis of the disease.

original: nad kyi rkyen las byung ba'i skom dad la ni 'u su'i 'bras bu chur bskol ba'i khu bar kha ra dang sbrang rtsi btab pa phan no //
analyzed: nad kyi rkyen las byung ba'i skom dad la ni 'u su'i 'bras bu chur bskol ba'i khu bar kha ra dang sbrang rtsi btab pa phan no //
translated: In the thirst which arises from the condition of the disease, the juice of the fruit of the emblic myrobalan boiled in water, with sugar and honey, is beneficial.

original: de bzhin du nad gzhi gang dag gyur pa la ltos nas btud ba'i bcos thabs kyi bya ba thams cad kyang bsngags pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du nad gzhi gang dag gyur pa la ltos nas btud ba'i bcos thabs kyi bya ba thams cad kyang bsngags pa yin no //
translated: And likewise, in consideration of whatever the basis of the disease is, all the actions of the treatment of drinking are recommended.

original: skom zhing sngar gyi nad kyis gzir //
analyzed: skom zhing sngar gyi nad kyis gzir //
translated: If one is thirsty and oppressed by a previous disease,

original: chu dang phrad par ma gyur na //
analyzed: chu dang phrad par ma gyur na //
translated: and does not get water,

original: 'chi ba'am yun ring ba yi nad //
analyzed: 'chi ba'am yun ring ba yi nad //
translated: one will either die or get a long-lasting disease.

original: rnyed par 'gyur bas de yi phyir //
analyzed: rnyed par 'gyur bas de yi phyir //
translated: Therefore,

original: goms pa'i zas skom sman gyis ni //
analyzed: goms pa'i zas skom sman gyis ni //
translated: with the medicine of food and drink which is habitual,

original: de yi skom dad myur bsal bya //
analyzed: de yi skom dad myur bsal bya //
translated: one should quickly remove that thirst.

original: de bsal nad ni gzhan dag kyang //
analyzed: de bsal nad ni gzhan dag kyang //
translated: When that is removed, the other diseases

original: gso ba nyid du nus pa yin //
analyzed: gso ba nyid du nus pa yin //
translated: can be cured.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this verse,

original: mi skom pas gdungs la sngar byung ba'i nad kyis gzir bas lus zungs zad par gyur pa dang / chu 'dod par gyur pa chu dang phrad par ma gyur na myur du 'chi bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: mi skom pas gdungs la sngar byung ba'i nad kyis gzir bas lus zungs zad par gyur pa dang / chu 'dod par gyur pa chu dang phrad par ma gyur na myur du 'chi bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: a person tormented by thirst, afflicted by a previous disease, with depleted bodily constituents, and desiring water, if not encountering water, will quickly die.

original: yang na yun ring zhing 'byang dka' ba'i nad skyed par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: yang na yun ring zhing 'byang dka' ba'i nad skyed par 'gyur bas /
translated: Or, it will give rise to a long-lasting and difficult-to-cure disease.

original: de'i phyir sgom zhing nad kyis nyam thag pa'i mi de la gang goms par gyur ba'i zas dang skom dang / sman gyis de'i skom dad myur ba kho nar gso bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgom zhing nad kyis nyam thag pa'i mi de la gang goms par gyur ba'i zas dang skom dang / sman gyis de'i skom dad myur ba kho nar gso bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, for that person afflicted by disease, with the food, drink, and medicine to which they are accustomed, one should quickly cure their thirst.

original: de gsos nas de las gyur ba'i nad kyi bla brnan gzhan dag bde blag kho nar gso zhing bsal ba nyid du nus pa yin no //
analyzed: de gsos nas de las gyur ba'i nad kyi bla brnan gzhan dag bde blag kho nar gso zhing bsal ba nyid du nus pa yin no //
translated: Having cured that, the other secondary diseases arising from that can be easily cured and removed.

original: yan lag brgyad pa'i snying po'i rnam par 'grel ba tshig gi don gyi zla zer zhes bya ba /
analyzed: yan lag brgyad pa'i snying po'i rnam par 'grel ba tshig gi don gyi zla zer zhes bya ba /
translated: The Moonlight of the Meaning of the Words, a commentary on the essence of the eight branches.

original: slob dpon zla ba la dga' bas nges par sbyar ba las /
analyzed: slob dpon zla ba la dga' bas nges par sbyar ba las /
translated: This is from the master Candrakīrti’s work entitled Engaging in the Middle Way.🔽

original: gso ba'i gnas le'u drug pa'i rnam par 'grel pa'o /🔽// / @266a * //  de nas chang nad gso ba'i le'u bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: gso ba'i gnas le'u drug pa'i rnam par 'grel pa'o / // / @266a * //  de nas chang nad gso ba'i le'u bshad par bya'o //
translated: This is the commentary on the sixth chapter of the Explanatory Tantra,🔽called “The Healing of the Humors.”

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Now, the chapter on the treatment of alcohol disorders will be explained.

original: sngar nad gzhi ji ltar bstan ba de bzhin du gso ba yang rim pa de ltar bshad pas 'dir 'di brtsams pa yin no //
analyzed: sngar nad gzhi ji ltar bstan ba de bzhin du gso ba yang rim pa de ltar bshad pas 'dir 'di brtsams pa yin no //
translated: As the disorders are taught, so the treatment is explained in the same order.

original: nyes pa gang zhig shas cher mthong //
analyzed: nyes pa gang zhig shas cher mthong //
translated: Whatever fault is seen to be predominant,

original: de ni dang por gso bar bya ;🔽/ zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni dang por gso bar bya ; / zhes bya ba la /
translated: that should be treated first.

original: chang gi nad thams cad ni nad gzhi gsum char las skyes pa yin pas 'di skad ces bshad de /
analyzed: chang gi nad thams cad ni nad gzhi gsum char las skyes pa yin pas 'di skad ces bshad de /
translated: All alcohol disorders arise from all three humors, so it is explained in this way.

original: chang gi nad 'di la rlung la sogs pa'i nad gzhi nyes pa gang shas che bar mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: chang gi nad 'di la rlung la sogs pa'i nad gzhi nyes pa gang shas che bar mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: In this alcohol disorder, whatever fault of the humors such as wind is seen to be predominant,

original: dang por de thog ma kho nar gso zhing dpyad kyis bcos par bya ste ;
analyzed: dang por de thog ma kho nar gso zhing dpyad kyis bcos par bya ste ;
translated: that should be treated first, at the very beginning, with a treatment.

original: de ltar na chang nad nad gzhi ma snyoms par gso bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na chang nad nad gzhi ma snyoms par gso bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, alcohol disorders are to be treated by balancing the humors.

original: yang na chang nad nad gzhi mtshungs //
analyzed: yang na chang nad nad gzhi mtshungs //
translated: Or else, like a disease of alcohol.🔽🔽

original: bad kan gnas kyi rim pas gso //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bad kan gnas kyi rim pas gso // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Or else, the treatment is according to the order of the humors in the case of a disease similar to a hangover.🔽The treatment is according to the order of the humors in the case of a disease similar to a hangover.

original: yang chang nad nad gzhi mtshungs shing gang zhig la gang yang lhag par gyur pa med pa de la ni bad kan gyi gnas kyi go rims kyis nad gso bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang chang nad nad gzhi mtshungs shing gang zhig la gang yang lhag par gyur pa med pa de la ni bad kan gyi gnas kyi go rims kyis nad gso bar bya'o //
translated: In the case of a disease similar to a hangover, where there is no excess of any one humor, the treatment is according to the order of the humors.

original: de yang dang por ni bad kan gso bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang dang por ni bad kan gso bar bya'o //
translated: And that is as follows: First, the phlegm is treated.

original: de'i 'og tu mkhris pa tha mar ni rlung gso bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mkhris pa tha mar ni rlung gso bar bya'o //
translated: After that, the bile. In the end, the wind.

original: go rims 'di nyid kyis rim pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir smras pa ni /🔽mkhris pa rlung gi mthar thug par //
analyzed: go rims 'di nyid kyis rim pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir smras pa ni / mkhris pa rlung gi mthar thug par //
translated: In order to teach the order by this very order, it is said:🔽The majority of hangovers occur

original: chang nad phal cher 'byung ba yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chang nad phal cher 'byung ba yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: in the order of bile, wind, and so on.

original: gang gi phyir chang nad thams cad la dus kyi rim pas mkhris pa dang rlung gi mthar thug par 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir chang nad thams cad la dus kyi rim pas mkhris pa dang rlung gi mthar thug par 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni /
translated: Because in all hangovers, in the order of time, the occurrence of bile and wind is

original: chang nad phal po che'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: chang nad phal po che'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: the nature of the majority of hangovers.

original: dang por ni bad kan lhag cing shas che ba yin la /
analyzed: dang por ni bad kan lhag cing shas che ba yin la /
translated: In the beginning, phlegm is predominant and excessive.

original: de'i 'og tu ni mkhris pa dang rlung shas che bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ni mkhris pa dang rlung shas che bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: After that, bile and wind increase.

original: dman dang log pa drags 'thungs las //
analyzed: dman dang log pa drags 'thungs las //
translated: From drinking less, wrongly, or too much,

original: nad ni gang zhig skyes gyur pa //🔽de nyid cha mnyam 'thungs pa yis //
analyzed: nad ni gang zhig skyes gyur pa // de nyid cha mnyam 'thungs pa yis //
translated: whatever illness arises🔽is pacified by that very beer

original: chang nyid kyis ni zhi bar 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba la /🔽goms pa'i dbang las shas chung bar 'thungs pa'am /🔽phyin ci log tu 'thungs pa'am /
analyzed: chang nyid kyis ni zhi bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba la / goms pa'i dbang las shas chung bar 'thungs pa'am / phyin ci log tu 'thungs pa'am /
translated: when drunk in equal measure.

original: 'thungs drags pa las nad gang zhig skyes shing 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i nad de la ni chang de nyid cha mnyam par 'thungs shing ran par 'thungs pa gang yin pa des zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'thungs drags pa las nad gang zhig skyes shing 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i nad de la ni chang de nyid cha mnyam par 'thungs shing ran par 'thungs pa gang yin pa des zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From the power of habituation, drinking less, drinking wrongly, or drinking too much, whatever illness arises and occurs, that illness is pacified by that very beer when drunk in equal measure, that is, when drunk in the right amount.🔽And that is explained in this way:

original: de yang / mkhas pas chang ni dus kun du //
analyzed: de yang / mkhas pas chang ni dus kun du //
translated: The wise should drink beer

original: ji srid mthong ba @266b ma 'khrul cing //
analyzed: ji srid mthong ba @266b ma 'khrul cing //
translated: as long as their vision is not confused,

original: ji srid yid ni ma g-yos pa //
analyzed: ji srid yid ni ma g-yos pa //
translated: as long as their mind is not disturbed,

original: de srid bar du btung bar bya //
analyzed: de srid bar du btung bar bya //
translated: and as long as they are not satiated.

original: zhes bshad pa'i tshul gyis btung ba ni chang cha mnyam par 'thungs pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i tshul gyis btung ba ni chang cha mnyam par 'thungs pa yin te /
translated: Drinking in this way is drinking beer in equal measure.

original: de nas rgun chang la sogs pa'i chang ngam /🔽sprang chang ngam /
analyzed: de nas rgun chang la sogs pa'i chang ngam / sprang chang ngam /
translated: Then, from drinking wine, grape wine, etc.,🔽or from drinking a wine of the poor,🔽or from drinking molasses, etc.,

original: bu ram la sogs pa gang zhig 'thungs nyes pa las nad du 'gyur te /
analyzed: bu ram la sogs pa gang zhig 'thungs nyes pa las nad du 'gyur te /
translated: a disease arises.

original: chang de nyid ran par 'thungs pas de zhi bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: chang de nyid ran par 'thungs pas de zhi bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: That is cured by drinking just that wine in the right amount,

original: chang gzhan dag gis ni ma yin la //
analyzed: chang gzhan dag gis ni ma yin la //
translated: but not by other wines.

original: ji ltar na gang gis nad skyed pa de nyid kyis zhi bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na gang gis nad skyed pa de nyid kyis zhi bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it that that which produces a disease is cured by that very thing?

original: chang ni dug dang mtshungs pa las //🔽dug ni rno sogs yon tan gyi //
analyzed: chang ni dug dang mtshungs pa las // dug ni rno sogs yon tan gyi //
translated: Wine is like poison.🔽Poison is very powerful

original: nus pa shin tu che bas na ;
analyzed: nus pa shin tu che bas na ;
translated: because of its qualities of sharpness, etc.

original: / dug gzhan la ni ltos pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / dug gzhan la ni ltos pa yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It depends on another poison.

original: dper na dug ni rno ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na dug ni rno ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, poison has the qualities of sharpness, etc.🔽In the same way, wine has the qualities of sharpness, etc.

original: chang yang rno ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas de'i chang las skyes pa'i nad chang nyid kyis zhi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: chang yang rno ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pas de'i chang las skyes pa'i nad chang nyid kyis zhi bar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, a disease produced by wine is cured by wine itself,

original: gzhan dag gis ni ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis ni ma yin la /
translated: but not by other things.

original: dug ni rno ba la sogs pa'i yon tan bcu po nus pa lhag par che ba dang ldan pas dug gzhan la ltos pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: dug ni rno ba la sogs pa'i yon tan bcu po nus pa lhag par che ba dang ldan pas dug gzhan la ltos pa nyid yin no //
translated: Poison has ten qualities such as sharpness, and it is superior in potency. Therefore, poison depends on other things.🔽And it is said in the treatise:

original: de yang / gzhung las rgyu dang mi rgyu'i dug / mtshungs kyang gzhan la ltos pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang / gzhung las rgyu dang mi rgyu'i dug / mtshungs kyang gzhan la ltos pa yin // zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Although the poison of plants and animals are similar, they depend on other things.

original: de ltar na chang dang dug gnyis ni rno ba la sogs pa mtshungs pa yin du zin kyang nus pa chen po dang chung ba'i dbye bas chang ni chang gzhan la ltos par mi byed kyi rang gi rigs mthun pa nyid kyis zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na chang dang dug gnyis ni rno ba la sogs pa mtshungs pa yin du zin kyang nus pa chen po dang chung ba'i dbye bas chang ni chang gzhan la ltos par mi byed kyi rang gi rigs mthun pa nyid kyis zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, although alcohol and poison are similar in sharpness, etc., because of the distinction of great and small potency, alcohol does not depend on other alcohol, but is pacified by its own kind.🔽When one drinks a lot of sharp alcohol,

original: rno tshe lhag par 'thungs pa dang // tsha zhing skyur ba dag gis ni //
analyzed: rno tshe lhag par 'thungs pa dang // tsha zhing skyur ba dag gis ni //
translated: it is hot and sour.

original: chang gis zas kyi ro bsrul zhing //🔽'ju nyer ba tsha bro gang yin //🔽myos dang skom rmongs nad du tsha //
analyzed: chang gis zas kyi ro bsrul zhing // 'ju nyer ba tsha bro gang yin // myos dang skom rmongs nad du tsha //
translated: Alcohol destroys the taste of food.🔽It is hard to digest and causes indigestion.🔽It causes intoxication, thirst, and confusion.

original: rims dang mgo 'khor skyed par byed //
analyzed: rims dang mgo 'khor skyed par byed //
translated: It produces fever and dizziness.

original: chang gis bslangs pa'i nad kyis ni //
analyzed: chang gis bslangs pa'i nad kyis ni //
translated: Diseases produced by alcohol

original: rlung rgyu'i bu ga bkag gyur pas //🔽mgo dang rus pa tshigs rnams su //
analyzed: rlung rgyu'i bu ga bkag gyur pas // mgo dang rus pa tshigs rnams su //
translated: When the openings of the channels are blocked,

original: mi bzad par ni skyed par byed //🔽sbyor ba rjes mthun gyur pa yi //🔽chang nyid kyis ni de sel 'gyur //
analyzed: mi bzad par ni skyed par byed // sbyor ba rjes mthun gyur pa yi // chang nyid kyis ni de sel 'gyur //
translated: it produces unbearable pain in the head, bones, and joints.🔽That is removed by beer that is suitable for the combination.

original: chang nad ma zhu zhu gyur na //
analyzed: chang nad ma zhu zhu gyur na //
translated: When the indigestion of beer is digested,

original: zas 'dod lus ni yang bar 'gyur //
analyzed: zas 'dod lus ni yang bar 'gyur //
translated: one desires food and the body becomes light.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for the words,
